<A NAME="eolPage117"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	GE Portfolio Acquisition Facility
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the second quarter of 2015, concurrently with our acquisition of the GE portfolio, we entered into an agreement with Wells Fargo to
	provide us with secured financing for the acquired portfolio. During the second quarter of 2016, we increased the facility size by $125.0&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, this facility provided for $1.7&nbsp;billion of financing, of which
	$1.5&nbsp;billion was outstanding and an additional&nbsp;$178.2&nbsp;million was available to finance future loan fundings in the GE portfolio. The GE portfolio acquisition facility is
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-revolving
</FONT>
	and
	consists of a single master repurchase agreement providing for both (i)&nbsp;asset-specific borrowings for each collateral asset as well as (ii)&nbsp;a sequential pay advance feature.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Asset-Specific Borrowings
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
	asset-specific borrowings under the GE portfolio acquisition facility were advanced at a weighted-average rate of 80% of our purchase price of the collateral assets and will be repaid pro rata from collateral asset repayment proceeds. The
	asset-specific borrowings are currency matched to the collateral assets and accrue interest at a rate equal to the sum of (i)&nbsp;the applicable base rate plus (ii)&nbsp;a margin of 1.75%, which will increase to 1.80% and 1.85% in year four and
	year five, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, those borrowings were denominated in U.S. Dollars, Canadian Dollars, British Pounds Sterling, and Euros. The asset-specific borrowings are term matched to the underlying collateral assets with
	an outside maturity date of May&nbsp;20, 2020, which may be extended pursuant to two
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	extension options. We guarantee obligations under the GE portfolio acquisition facility in an amount equal to the
	greater of (i) 25% of outstanding asset-specific borrowings, and (ii) $250.0&nbsp;million. We had outstanding asset-specific borrowings of $1.5&nbsp;billion and $3.1&nbsp;billion under the GE portfolio acquisition facility as of December&nbsp;31,
	2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Sequential Pay Advance
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The GE portfolio acquisition facility also included a sequential pay advance feature that provided for $237.2&nbsp;million of borrowings,
	representing an additional 5% advance against each collateral asset pledged under the facility. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the sequential pay advance borrowings under the GE portfolio acquisition facility had been fully repaid. As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had outstanding sequential pay advance borrowings of $40.7&nbsp;million. Borrowings under the sequential pay advance accrued interest at a rate equal to the sum of (i)
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	30-day
</FONT>
	LIBOR
	plus (ii)&nbsp;a margin of 3.10%. The sequential pay advance was denominated in U.S. Dollars and was repaid from collateral loan principal repayments, after repayment of the related asset-specific borrowing. The sequential pay advances each had a
	maturity date that was one year from the date of funding, and we had guaranteed 100% of outstanding borrowings of the sequential pay advance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-26
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage118"></A>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	These floating rate loans and related liabilities are indexed to the various benchmark rates relevant in each
	arrangement in terms of currency and payment frequency. Therefore the net exposure to each benchmark rate is in direct proportion to our net assets indexed to that rate. In addition to cash coupon, yield/cost includes the amortization of deferred
	origination fees / financing costs.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Other than amounts guaranteed on an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	asset-by-asset
</FONT>
</FONT>
	basis, borrowings under our asset-specific financings are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recourse
</FONT>
	to us.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	The weighted-average term is determined based on the maximum maturity of the corresponding loans, assuming all
	extension options are exercised by the borrower. Each of our asset-specific financings are term-matched to the corresponding collateral loans.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Borrowings under these asset specific financings are cross collateralized with the related revolving
	repurchase facility with the same lender.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-27
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	These floating rate loans and related liabilities are indexed to the various benchmark rates relevant in each
	arrangement in terms of currency and payment frequency. Therefore the net exposure to each benchmark rate is in direct proportion to our net assets indexed to that rate. In addition to cash coupon, yield/cost includes the amortization of deferred
	origination fees / financing costs.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Other than amounts guaranteed on an
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	asset-by-asset
</FONT>
</FONT>
	basis, borrowings under our asset-specific financings are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recourse
</FONT>
	to us.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	The weighted-average term is determined based on the maximum maturity of the corresponding loans, assuming all
	extension options are exercised by the borrower. Each of our asset-specific financings are term-matched to the corresponding collateral loans.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Borrowings under these asset specific financings are cross collateralized with the related revolving
	repurchase facility with the same lender.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The weighted-average outstanding balance of our asset-specific financings was
	$584.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and $574.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Revolving Credit
	Agreement
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the second quarter of 2016, we entered into a $125.0&nbsp;million full recourse secured revolving credit agreement
	with Barclays that is designed to finance first mortgage originations for up to six months as a bridge to term financing or syndication. Advances under the agreement are subject to availability under a specified borrowing base and accrue interest at
	a per annum pricing rate equal to the sum of (i)&nbsp;an applicable base rate or Eurodollar rate and (ii)&nbsp;an applicable margin, in each case, dependent on the applicable type of loan collateral. The initial maturity date of the facility is
	April&nbsp;4, 2018 and is subject to two
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	extension options, exercisable at our option.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the weighted-average outstanding borrowings under the revolving credit agreement were
	$31.6&nbsp;million and we recorded interest expense of $1.4&nbsp;million, including $376,000 of amortization of deferred fees and expenses. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 we had no outstanding borrowings under the agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-28
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage120"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Debt Covenants
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Each of the guarantees related to our secured debt agreements contain the following uniform financial covenants: (i)&nbsp;our ratio of earnings
	before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization, or EBITDA, to fixed charges, as defined in the agreements, shall be not less than 1.4 to 1.0; (ii) our tangible net worth, as defined in the agreements, shall not be less than $1.9&nbsp;billion
	as of each measurement date plus 75% of the net cash proceeds of future equity issuances subsequent to December&nbsp;31, 2016; (iii) cash liquidity shall not be less than the greater of (x) $10.0&nbsp;million or (y) 5% of our recourse indebtedness;
	and (iv)&nbsp;our indebtedness shall not exceed 83.33% of our total assets. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2015, we were in compliance with these covenants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	7. LOAN PARTICIPATIONS SOLD, NET
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
	financing of a loan by the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recourse
</FONT>
	sale of a senior interest in the loan through a participation agreement generally does not qualify as a sale under GAAP. Therefore, in the instance of such sales, we
	present the whole loan as an asset and the loan participation sold as a liability on our consolidated balance sheet until the loan is repaid. The obligation to pay principal and interest on these liabilities is generally based on the performance of
	the related loan obligation. The gross presentation of loan participations sold does not impact stockholders&#146; equity or net income.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following table details statistics for our loan participations sold ($ in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Our floating rate loans and related liabilities were indexed to the various benchmark rates relevant in each
	arrangement in terms of currency and payment frequency. Therefore the net exposure to each benchmark rate is in direct proportion to our net assets indexed to that rate. In addition to cash coupon, yield/cost includes the amortization of deferred
	fees / financing costs.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Other than one instance where we entered into a related guarantee agreement for &pound;24.0&nbsp;million
	($29.6&nbsp;million and $35.6 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively), our loan participations sold are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-recourse
</FONT>
	to us.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(3)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we recorded $13.7&nbsp;million and $18.3&nbsp;million,
	respectively, of interest expense related to our loan participations sold, of which $13.1&nbsp;million and $16.9&nbsp;million was paid in cash.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	The difference between principal balance and book value of loan participations sold is due to deferred
	financing costs of $1.6&nbsp;million and $2.0&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8. CONVERTIBLE
	NOTES, NET
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In November 2013, we issued $172.5&nbsp;million of 5.25% convertible senior notes due on December&nbsp;1, 2018, or
	Convertible Notes. The Convertible Notes&#146; issuance costs are amortized through interest expense over the life of the Convertible Notes using the effective interest method. Including this amortization, our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	all-in
</FONT>
	cost of the Convertible Notes is 5.87% per annum.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-29
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Convertible Notes are convertible at the holders&#146; option into shares of our class A
	common stock, only under specific circumstances, prior to the close of business on August&nbsp;31, 2018, at the applicable conversion rate in effect on the conversion date. Thereafter, the Convertible Notes are convertible at the option of the
	holder at any time until the second scheduled trading day immediately preceding the maturity date. The Convertible Notes were not convertible as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. The conversion rate was initially set to equal 34.8943 shares of class A
	common stock per $1,000 principal amount of Convertible Notes, which was equivalent to an initial conversion price of $28.66 per share of class A common stock, subject to adjustment upon the occurrence of certain events. As a result of exceeding the
	cumulative dividend threshold as defined in the Convertible Notes Supplemental Indenture, the conversion rate was adjusted on September&nbsp;28, 2016 to 35.7236 shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock per $1,000 principal amount of Convertible Notes,
	which is equivalent to a conversion price of $27.99 per share of class A common stock. We may not redeem the Convertible Notes prior to maturity. The last reported sale price of our Class&nbsp;A common stock of $30.07 on December&nbsp;30, 2016, the
	last trading day in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, was greater than the per share conversion price of the Convertible Notes. We have the intent and ability to settle the Convertible Notes in cash and, as a result, the Convertible Notes did
	not have any impact on our diluted earnings per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Upon issuance of the Convertible Notes, we recorded a $9.1&nbsp;million discount
	based on the implied value of the conversion option and an assumed effective interest rate of 6.50%, as well as $4.1&nbsp;million of initial issuance costs. Including the amortization of this discount and the issuance costs, our total cost of the
	Convertible Notes is 7.16% per annum. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, we incurred total interest on our convertible notes of $11.8&nbsp;million, of which $9.1&nbsp;million related to cash coupon and $2.7&nbsp;million related to the
	amortization of discount and certain issuance costs. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we incurred total interest on our convertible notes of $11.6&nbsp;million, of which $9.1&nbsp;million related to cash coupon and $2.5&nbsp;million
	related to the amortization of discount and certain issuance costs. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we incurred total interest on our convertible notes of $11.5&nbsp;million, of which $9.1&nbsp;million related to cash coupon and
	$2.4&nbsp;million related to the amortization of discount and certain issuance costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the Convertible Notes
	were carried on our consolidated balance sheet at $166.8&nbsp;million, net of an unamortized discount of $5.5&nbsp;million and deferred financing costs of $206,000. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Convertible Notes were carried on our consolidated
	balance sheet at $164.0&nbsp;million, net of an unamortized discount of $8.2&nbsp;million and deferred financing costs of $305,000. Accrued interest payable for the Convertible Notes was $755,000 as of both December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015. Refer to
	Note 2 for additional discussion of our accounting policies for the Convertible Notes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9. DERIVATIVE FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The sole objective of our use of derivative financial instruments is to minimize the risks and/or costs associated with our investments and/or
	financing transactions. These derivatives may or may not qualify as net investment, cash flow, or fair value hedges under the hedge accounting requirements of ASC 815 &#150; &#147;Derivatives and Hedging.&#148; Derivatives not designated as hedges
	are not speculative and are used to manage our exposure to interest rate movements and other identified risks. For more information on the accounting for designated and
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-designated
</FONT>
	hedges, refer to Note 2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The use of derivative financial instruments involves certain risks, including the risk that the counterparties to these contractual
	arrangements do not perform as agreed. To mitigate this risk, we only enter into derivative financial instruments with counterparties that have appropriate credit ratings and are major financial institutions with which we and our affiliates may also
	have other financial relationships. We do not anticipate that any of the counterparties will fail to meet their obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-30
</P>

<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Net Investment Hedges of Foreign Currency Risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Certain of our international investments expose us to fluctuations in foreign interest rates and currency exchange rates. These fluctuations
	may impact the value of our cash receipts and payments in terms of our functional currency, the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar. We use foreign currency forward contracts to protect the value or fix the amount of certain investments or cash flows in terms of the
	U.S.&nbsp;Dollar.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following table details our outstanding foreign exchange derivatives that were designated as net investment hedges
	of foreign currency risk (notional amount in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Cash Flow Hedges of Interest Rate Risk
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Certain of our financing transactions expose us to a fixed versus floating rate mismatch between our assets and liabilities. We use derivative
	financial instruments, which include interest rate caps and swaps, and may also include interest rate options, floors, and other interest rate derivative contracts, to hedge interest rate risk associated with our borrowings where there is potential
	for an index mismatch.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The following tables detail our outstanding interest rate derivatives that were designated as cash flow hedges of
	interest rate risk (notional amount in thousands):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Two of our interest rate swaps totaling C$91.0&nbsp;million ($67.7&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2016)
	do not become effective until June&nbsp;1, 2017.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Amounts reported in accumulated other comprehensive income related to
	derivatives will be reclassified to interest expense as interest payments are made on our floating rate debt. During the twelve months following December&nbsp;31, 2016, we estimate that an additional $932,000 will be reclassified from accumulated
	other comprehensive income as an increase to interest expense. Additionally, during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we did not record any hedge ineffectiveness in our consolidated statements of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-31
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-designated
</FONT>
	Hedges
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we recorded losses of $1.9&nbsp;million and $698,000, respectively, related to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-designated
</FONT>
	hedges that were reported as a component of interest expense in our consolidated financial statements. We did not have any losses related to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-designated
</FONT>
	hedges during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1,000
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_54"></A>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we received net cash settlements of $26.8&nbsp;million
	and $18.8&nbsp;million on our foreign currency forward contracts, respectively. Those amounts are included as a component of accumulated other comprehensive loss on our consolidated balance sheets. We did not receive net cash settlements on our
	foreign currency contracts during 2014.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Credit-Risk Related Contingent Features
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We have entered into agreements with certain of our derivative counterparties that contain provisions where if we were to default on any of our
	indebtedness, including default where repayment of the indebtedness has not been accelerated by the lender, we may also be declared in default on our derivative obligations. In addition, certain of our agreements with our derivative counterparties
	require that we post collateral to secure net liability positions. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we were in a net asset position with each such derivative counterparty.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10. EQUITY
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Stock and Stock Equivalents
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Authorized Capital
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had the authority to issue up to 300,000,000 shares of stock, consisting of 200,000,000 shares of class A common stock and 100,000,000 shares of preferred stock. Subject to applicable NYSE listing requirements, our board
	of directors is authorized to cause us to issue additional shares of authorized stock without stockholder approval. In addition, to the extent not issued, currently authorized stock may be reclassified between class A common stock and preferred
	stock. We did not have any shares of preferred stock issued and outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Class&nbsp;A Common Stock and Deferred Stock
	Units
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Holders of shares of our class&nbsp;A common stock are entitled to vote on all matters submitted to a vote of stockholders and
	are entitled to receive such dividends as may be authorized by our board of directors and declared by us, in all cases subject to the rights of the holders of shares of outstanding preferred stock, if any.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-33
</P>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;MARGIN-LEFT:4%;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	five-day

	period in
	May 2015 under our

	program.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We also issue restricted class A common stock under our stock-based incentive plans. Refer to Note 13
	for additional discussion of these long-term incentive plans. In addition to our class A common stock, we also issue deferred stock units to certain members of our board of directors in lieu of cash compensation for services rendered. These deferred
	stock units are
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-voting,
</FONT>
	but carry the right to receive dividends in the form of additional deferred stock units in an amount equivalent to the cash dividends paid to holders of shares of class A common
	stock.

</TD>

	(2)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Includes issuance of 1,070, 597, and six shares under our dividend reinvestment program during the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Dividend Reinvestment and Direct Stock Purchase Plan
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On March&nbsp;25, 2014, we adopted a dividend reinvestment and direct stock purchase plan, under which we registered and reserved for issuance,
	in the aggregate, 10,000,000 shares of class A common stock. Under the dividend reinvestment component of this plan, our class A common stockholders can designate all or a portion of their cash dividends to be reinvested in additional shares of
	class A common stock. The direct stock purchase component allows stockholders and new investors, subject to our approval, to purchase shares of class A common stock directly from us. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014 we
	issued 1,070&nbsp;shares, 597 shares, and six shares, respectively, of class A common stock under the dividend reinvestment component of the plan. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, a total of 9,998,327&nbsp;shares of class A common stock remained
	available for issuance under the dividend reinvestment and direct stock purchase plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-34
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage126"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	At the Market Stock Offering Program
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On May&nbsp;9, 2014, we entered into equity distribution agreements, or ATM Agreements, pursuant to which we may sell, from time to time, up to
	an aggregate sales price of $200.0&nbsp;million of our class A common stock. On July&nbsp;29, 2016, in connection with filing a new universal shelf registration statement on Form
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	S-3,
</FONT>
	we entered into
	amendments to each of the ATM Agreements. Sales of class A common stock made pursuant to the ATM Agreements may be made in negotiated transactions or transactions that are deemed to be &#147;at the market&#148; offerings as defined in Rule 415 under
	the Securities Act of 1933, as amended. Actual sales will depend on a variety of factors including market conditions, the trading price of our class A common stock, our capital needs, and our determination of the appropriate sources of funding to
	meet such needs. We did not sell any shares of our class A common stock under the ATM Agreements during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 we sold 280,025 shares of class A common stock under the ATM
	Agreements, with net proceeds totaling $7.9&nbsp;million. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, sales of our class A common stock with an aggregate sales price of $188.6&nbsp;million remained available for issuance under the ATM Agreements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We generally intend to
	distribute substantially all of our taxable income, which does not necessarily equal net income as calculated in accordance with GAAP, to our stockholders each year to comply with the REIT provisions of the Internal Revenue Code. Our
<B>
</B>
	dividend
	policy remains subject to revision at the discretion of our board of directors. All distributions will be made at the discretion of our board of directors and will depend upon our taxable income, our financial condition, our maintenance of REIT
	status, applicable law, and other factors as our board of directors deems relevant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On December&nbsp;14, 2016, we declared a dividend of
	$0.62&nbsp;per share, or $58.6&nbsp;million, that was paid on January&nbsp;13, 2017, to stockholders of record as of December&nbsp;30, 2016. The following table details our dividend activity ($ in thousands, except per share data):
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_58"></A>

<TR>

</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="10%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Earnings Per Share
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We calculate our basic and diluted earnings per share using the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	two-class
</FONT>
	method for all periods
	presented, as the unvested shares of our restricted class A common stock qualify as participating securities, as defined by GAAP. These restricted shares have the same rights as our other shares of class A common stock, including participating in
	any dividends, and therefore have been included in our basic and diluted net income per share calculation. Our Convertible Notes are excluded from dilutive earnings per share as we have the intent and ability to settle these instruments in cash.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-35
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Other Balance Sheet Items
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Accumulated Other
	Comprehensive Loss
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, total accumulated other comprehensive loss was $56.2&nbsp;million, primarily
	representing (i)&nbsp;$107.5&nbsp;million of cumulative unrealized currency translation adjustments on assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies and (ii)&nbsp;an offsetting $51.3&nbsp;million of net realized and unrealized gains
	related to changes in the fair value of derivative instruments. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, total accumulated other comprehensive loss was $32.8&nbsp;million, primarily representing (i)&nbsp;$57.8&nbsp;million of cumulative unrealized
	currency translation adjustments on assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies and (ii)&nbsp;an offsetting $25.0&nbsp;million of net realized and unrealized gains related to changes in the fair value of derivative instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Controlling
</FONT>
	Interests
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-controlling
</FONT>
	interests included on our consolidated balance sheets represent the equity
	interests in CT Legacy Partners that were not owned by us. A portion of CT Legacy Partners&#146; consolidated equity and results of operations were allocated to these
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-controlling
</FONT>
	interests based on their
	pro rata ownership of CT Legacy Partners. Our investment in CT Legacy Partners was substantially realized as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, and we no longer have any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-controlling
</FONT>
	interests on our consolidated
	financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	11. OTHER EXPENSES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our other expenses consist of the management and incentive fees we pay to our Manager and our general and administrative expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Management and Incentive Fees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant
	to our Management Agreement, our Manager earns a base management fee in an amount equal to 1.50% per annum multiplied by our outstanding equity balance, as defined in the Management Agreement. In addition, our Manager is entitled to an incentive fee
	in an amount equal to the product of (i) 20% and (ii)&nbsp;the excess of (a)&nbsp;our Core Earnings (as defined in our Management Agreement) for the previous
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	12-month
</FONT>
	period over (b)&nbsp;an amount equal to
	7.00% per annum multiplied by our outstanding Equity, provided that our Core Earnings over the prior three-year period is greater than zero. Core Earnings, as defined in our Management Agreement, is generally equal to our net income (loss) prepared
	in accordance with GAAP, excluding (i)&nbsp;certain
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	items (ii)&nbsp;the net income (loss) related to our legacy portfolio and (iii)&nbsp;incentive management fees.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-36
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage128"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we incurred
	$38.0&nbsp;million, $32.2&nbsp;million, and $17.8&nbsp;million, respectively, of management fees payable to our Manager. In addition, during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we incurred $18.0&nbsp;million, $10.7&nbsp;million,
	and $1.7&nbsp;million, respectively, of incentive fees payable to our Manager.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we had accrued
	management and incentive fees payable to our Manager of $12.8&nbsp;million and $14.4&nbsp;million, respectively.
</P>

	Total BXMT expenses

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(1)

	Represents the amounts recorded under the CT Legacy Partners management incentive awards during the period.
	See below for discussion of the CT Legacy Partners management incentive awards plan.
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	CT Legacy Partners Management Incentive Awards Plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In conjunction with our March 2011 restructuring, we created an employee pool for up to 6.75% of the distributions paid to the common equity
	holders of CT Legacy Partners (subject to certain caps and priority distributions). During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we recognized $1.1&nbsp;million, $2.2&nbsp;million, and $1.4&nbsp;million, respectively, of expenses
	under the CT Legacy Partners incentive plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	12. INCOME TAXES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We elected to be taxed as a REIT, effective January&nbsp;1, 2003, under the Internal Revenue Code for U.S. federal income tax purposes. We
	generally must distribute annually at least 90% of our net taxable income, subject to certain adjustments and excluding any net capital gain, in order for U.S. federal income tax not to apply to our
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-37
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	earnings that we distribute. To the extent that we satisfy this distribution requirement, but distribute less than 100% of our net taxable income, we will be subject to U.S. federal income tax on
	our undistributed taxable income. In addition, we will be subject to a 4% nondeductible excise tax if the actual amount that we pay out to our stockholders in a calendar year is less than a minimum amount specified under U.S. federal tax laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our qualification as a REIT also depends on our ability to meet various other requirements imposed by the Internal Revenue Code, which relate
	to organizational structure, diversity of stock ownership, and certain restrictions with regard to the nature of our assets and the sources of our income. Even if we qualify as a REIT, we may be subject to certain U.S. federal income and excise
	taxes and state and local taxes on our income and assets. If we fail to maintain our qualification as a REIT for any taxable year, we may be subject to material penalties as well as federal, state, and local income tax on our taxable income at
	regular corporate rates and we would not be able to qualify as a REIT for the subsequent four full taxable years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, we were in compliance with all REIT requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we recorded a current income tax provision of $196,000, $504,000, and $518,000,
	respectively, primarily related to activities of our taxable REIT subsidiaries and various state and local taxes. We did not have any deferred tax assets or liabilities as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 or 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had estimated net operating losses, or NOLs, of $159.0&nbsp;million available to be carried forward and
	utilized in current or future periods. If we are unable to utilize our NOLs, they will expire in 2029. As a result of our issuance of 25,875,000 shares of class A common stock in May 2013, the availability of our then outstanding NOLs is generally
	limited to $2.0&nbsp;million per annum by change of control provisions promulgated by the Internal Revenue Service with respect to the ownership of Blackstone Mortgage Trust.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, tax years 2013 through 2016 remain subject to examination by taxing authorities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	13. STOCK-BASED INCENTIVE PLANS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We do
	not have any employees as we are externally managed by our Manager. However, as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, our Manager, certain individuals employed by an affiliate of our Manager, and certain members of our board of directors were compensated, in
	part, through the issuance of stock-based instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We had stock-based incentive awards outstanding under seven benefit plans as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016: (i)&nbsp;our amended and restated 1997
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-employee
</FONT>
	director stock plan, or 1997 Plan; (ii)&nbsp;our 2007 long-term incentive plan, or 2007 Plan; (iii)&nbsp;our 2011 long-term incentive
	plan, or 2011 Plan; (iv)&nbsp;our 2013 stock incentive plan, or 2013 Plan; (v)&nbsp;our 2013 manager incentive plan, or 2013 Manager Plan; (vi)&nbsp;our 2016 stock incentive plan, or 2016 Plan; and (vii)&nbsp;our 2016 manager incentive plan, or 2016
	Manager Plan. We refer to our 1997 Plan, our 2007 Plan, our 2011 Plan, our 2013 Plan, and our 2013 Manager Plan, collectively, as our Expired Plans and we refer to our 2016 Plan and 2016 Manager Plan, collectively, as our Current Plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	Our Expired Plans have expired and no new awards may be issued under them. Under our Current Plans, a maximum of 2,400,000 shares of our class
	A common stock may be issued to our Manager, our directors and officers, and certain employees of affiliates of our Manager. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there were 1,756,185&nbsp;shares available under the Current Plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-38
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	These shares generally vest in installments over a three-year period, pursuant to the terms of the respective
	award agreements and the terms of the Current Plans. The 1,309,995 shares of restricted class A common stock outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 will vest as follows: 656,233&nbsp;shares will vest in 2017; 445,166&nbsp;shares will vest in 2018;
	and 208,596&nbsp;shares will vest in 2019. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, total unrecognized compensation cost relating to nonvested share-based compensation arrangements was $39.4&nbsp;million based on the December&nbsp;31, 2016 closing price of our
	class A common stock of $30.07. This cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 1.2 years from December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the second quarter of 2016, $20.7&nbsp;million of collateralized debt obligations, or CDOs, were
	transferred out of Level&nbsp;3 and into Level&nbsp;1 as a result of a binding agreement to sell the underlying collateral assets of the CDO to an independent third-party. These investments were realized in the third quarter of 2016. Refer to Note 2
	for further discussion regarding fair value measurement. Refer to Note 2 for further discussion regarding fair value measurement.
</P>

	Estimates of fair value for cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, and convertible notes are measured
	using observable, quoted market prices, or Level&nbsp;1 inputs. All other fair value significant estimates are measured using unobservable inputs, or Level&nbsp;3 inputs. See Note 2 for further discussion regarding fair value measurement of certain
	of our assets and liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	15. TRANSACTIONS WITH RELATED PARTIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	We are managed by our Manager pursuant to the Management Agreement, the current term of which expires on December&nbsp;19, 2017, and will be
	automatically renewed for a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	one-year
</FONT>
	term each anniversary thereafter unless earlier terminated.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015, our consolidated balance sheet included
	$12.8&nbsp;million and $14.4&nbsp;million of accrued management and incentive fees payable to our Manager, respectively. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we paid $57.5&nbsp;million, $34.8&nbsp;million and
	$15.7&nbsp;million, respectively, of management and incentive fees to our Manager. In addition, during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we reimbursed our Manager for $462,000, $311,000, and $115,000, respectively, of expenses
	incurred on our behalf. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our consolidated balance sheet included $83,333 of preferred distributions payable by CT Legacy Partners to an affiliate of our Manager. There were no accrued preferred distributions payable by
	CT Legacy Partners as of December&nbsp;31, 2016. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, CT Legacy Partners made aggregate preferred distributions of $616,000, $1.3&nbsp;million, $2.1&nbsp;million, respectively, to such
	affiliate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, our Manager held 775,961&nbsp;shares of unvested restricted class A common stock, which had an
	aggregate grant date fair value of $22.5&nbsp;million. The shares vest in installments over three years from the date of issuance. During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we recorded
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	expenses related to these shares of $9.6&nbsp;million, $6.7&nbsp;million, and $3.8&nbsp;million, respectively. Refer to Note 13 for further details.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, we originated three loans whereby each respective borrower engaged an affiliate of our Manager
	to act as title insurance agent in connection with each transaction. The borrowers paid this affiliate aggregate fees of $346,000 for its services. We did not incur any expenses or receive any revenues as a result of this transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In the fourth quarter of 2016, we originated a $79.0&nbsp;million senior loan to a borrower to finance its purchase of a property that it
	acquired from an affiliate of our Manager. The purchase price of the property was fixed between the borrower and the affiliate of our Manager prior to us engaging in discussions with the borrower to act as its potential lender.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On May&nbsp;8, 2015, a joint venture of CT Legacy Partners, certain affiliates of our Manager, and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-affiliated
</FONT>
	parties, which we refer to as the Three-Pack JV, sold a hotel portfolio it owned to an investment vehicle managed by an affiliate of our Manager. We consented to the sale of the hotel portfolio
	by the Three-Pack JV, which resulted in the ultimate liquidation of the Three-Pack JV and distribution of net sale proceeds to CT Legacy Partners in respect of its investment therein. An aggregate of $41.3&nbsp;million of net sales proceeds has been
	received to date by CT Legacy Partners, of which $3.6&nbsp;million was received during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. As a result of the sale transaction, employees of our Manager, including certain of our executive officers, received
	incentive compensation payments totaling $2.8&nbsp;million under the CT Legacy Partners Management Incentive Awards Plan, of which $2.5&nbsp;million was paid during 2015, and the remaining $244,000 was paid during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2016. See Note 11 for further discussion of the CT Legacy Partners Management Incentive Awards Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	In conjunction with our April 2015
	stock offering, affiliates of our Manager, including certain of our executive officers and directors, purchased 1,885,245&nbsp;shares of our class A common stock at the same $30.50 per share price offered to the public. We did not, however, pay the
	underwriters any fees for these affiliate share purchases. An affiliate of our Manager acted as
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-manager
</FONT>
	of the offering, for which it was compensated $761,000 on terms consistent with those for other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-affiliated
</FONT>
	underwriters.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On April&nbsp;10, 2015, we entered into a memorandum of designation and
	understanding, or Designation Agreement, with GE and certain affiliates of our Manager to acquire a $4.6&nbsp;billion portfolio of commercial mortgage loans from GE. Pursuant to the terms of the Designation Agreement, we were designated as the
	purchaser of this loan portfolio by an affiliate of our Manager that entered into a purchase and sale agreement dated as of April&nbsp;10,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-41
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D307635D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	2015 with GE to acquire the majority of GE&#146;s global real estate debt and equity business for an aggregate purchase price of approximately $23.0&nbsp;billion. Certain transaction-related
	expenses incurred by us in connection with the acquisition of this loan portfolio represent an allocation of transaction expenses paid by affiliates of our Manager in connection with the overall acquisition transaction with GE. In August 2015, we
	paid an aggregate $53,000 to certain independent members of our board of directors for special committee services related to the GE portfolio acquisition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	On June&nbsp;20, 2014, CT Legacy Partners, CTOPI, our previously consolidated CT CDO I subsidiary, and other affiliates of our Manager entered
	into a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	deed-in-lieu
</FONT>
</FONT>
	of foreclosure transaction that resulted in a restructuring of the loan interests held by each entity. The interests held by CT Legacy Partners and
	CT CDO I had a principal balance of $8.0&nbsp;million and $27.0&nbsp;million, respectively, and a carrying value of zero and $27.0&nbsp;million, respectively, at the time of the transaction. During the fourth quarter of 2014, we fully impaired our
	interests in CT CDO I resulting in a loss on deconsolidation of $8.6&nbsp;million. During the fourth quarter of 2015, the collateral property securing the interests held by these entities was sold, with no net proceeds to our investments in CT
	Legacy Partners and CT CDO I. As a result of the collateral sale transaction, an affiliate of our Manager earned a $1.1&nbsp;million special servicing fee, which fee was not paid by us.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, a securitization vehicle previously consolidated in our financial statements incurred special
	servicing fees to our Manager of $522,000, of which it paid $139,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015, and 2014, we
	incurred $385,000, $372,000, and $202,000, respectively, of expenses for various administrative and capital market data services to third-party service providers that are affiliates of our Manager.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	16. COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Unfunded
	Commitments Under Loans Receivable
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we had unfunded commitments of $882.5&nbsp;million related to 58
	loans receivable, which amounts will generally be funded to finance lease-related or capital expenditures by our borrowers. These future commitments will expire variously over the next four years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Income Tax Audits of CTIMCO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	The Internal
	Revenue Service, or IRS, and the State of New York, or NYS, were previously examining the income tax returns for our former subsidiary, CT Investment Management Co., LLC, or CTIMCO. When we sold CTIMCO in December 2012, we provided certain
	indemnifications related to its operations, and any amounts determined to be owed by CTIMCO would ultimately be paid by us. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, both the IRS and NYS completed their examinations with no adjustments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Litigation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	From time to time, we may be
	involved in various claims and legal actions arising in the ordinary course of business. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, we were not involved in any material legal proceedings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Board of Directors&#146; Compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2016, of the eight members of our board of directors, our five independent directors are entitled to annual compensation of $125,000 each. The other three board members, including our chairman and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-42
</P>

<B>
	Blackstone Mortgage Trust, Inc.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(continued)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	our chief executive officer, serve as directors with no compensation. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the annual compensation for our directors was paid 40% in cash and 60% in the form of deferred
	stock units. In addition, the member of our board of directors that serves as the chairperson of the audit committee of our board of directors receives additional annual cash compensation of $12,000. Compensation to the board of directors is payable
	in four equal quarterly installments.
</P>

	Basic and diluted earnings per share are computed independently based on the weighted-average shares of common

</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	continued&#133;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Includes senior mortgages and similar credit quality loans, including related contiguous subordinate loans,
	and pari passu participations in senior mortgage loans.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(2)

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Maximum maturity date assumes all extension options are exercised.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(3)

	I/O = interest only, P/I = principal and interest.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	Represents only third party liens.

</TD>

	The tax basis of the loans included above is $8.3&nbsp;billion as of December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(6)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="JUSTIFY" STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
	Includes subordinate interests in mortgages and mezzanine loans.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	S-2
</P>
